data.text:
@AffenLovers @kamerlinlab @Listen49698651 It would be awfully strange for our entire family (including a 65+ on Chemotherapy) to have allllllll had asymptomatic cases.
And I had titers drawn for 18 months so I know I made it at least that long.

@runner_girl_RN @kamerlinlab @Listen49698651 You can't possibly know for sure if you already got Covid or not, since there's an incredible number of asymptomatic. I don't think you test yourself every day.

@gsdrules1 @kamerlinlab Over a million have died of COVID in just the US in a little over two years. It's airborne. You don't know if you'll live or die from it until you get it. No one knows the long term damage it does. 

Downplaying it or calling mask-wearing a cult, is offensive and dumb.
@pennylane1357 @kamerlinlab I am too! People are diverse and even within the same demographics don't share the same opinions.

@Listen49698651 @Rbf81 @kamerlinlab "the obvious prior?"
Are you trying to say that with every other virus, catching each variation makes you more protected? Bc that is not always the case: for instance, catching one strain of polio did not protect you against the others.
@runner_girl_RN @Rbf81 @kamerlinlab Because it's the obvious prior, and there's no good evidence otherwise.
@Rbf81 @kamerlinlab @Listen49698651 Why are you assuming you'll be more protected the next time you get it?

@kamerlinlab @runner_girl_RN @Listen49698651 I didn't get omicron, first time in gen 2020, probably original variant, and it's worse than delta in Nov 2021, not so much for symptoms but for long term short breath under fatigue. It's not a joke, but your vision is too dark IMO, next time you'll get it you are more protected
@kamerlinlab may be all this shit dosen't work?
